name: deinking emulsion production, in paper production | deinking emulsion, in paper production | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4569/documentation

The functional unit represent 1 kg of deinking emulsion. Very large uncertainty of the process data, as only a mixture of different materials is included.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



Mixture of hydrogen peroxide, sodium hydroxide, silica and fatty acid. Only input of mentioned substances is taken into account.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data used has no specific geographical origin (average from different indications in literature). Data are used as European average data.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: mixture of different substances without any further inputs/outputs
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography RER. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
